<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>
<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite DE Grund Guides", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	In Germany, education is regulated at the state level rather than at the
	national level. Each state defines its own models and methods of teaching
	handwriting in primary schools. The common goal is acquiring a personal style
	of connected handwriting at the end of primary school in fourth grade (10-11
	years old). Emphasis is on the flow of connected writing, letter recognition,
	and legibility, not the exact imitation of individual letters.
</p>
<p>
	In most states, teachers and schools can choose from three cursive styles:
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+DE+LA">
    Ausgangsschrift (LA)</a>,
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+DE+VA">
    Vereinfachte Ausgangsschrift (VA)</a>, and
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+DE+SAS">
    Schulausgangsschrift (SAS)</a>. But in 2010, the <em>Grundschulverband</em>, or Association of Primary
	Schools, presented an alternative progressive approach for handwriting
	teaching: <em>Grundschrift</em>, based primarily on a print-style script with
	some added cursive elements, like <em>Häckchen</em>, or exit strokes. Some
	German states, like Bremen and Hamburg, allow this method to be used in
	schools, in addition to the dominant Ausgangschrift systems. According to Das
	Deutsche Schulportal, Grundschrift is taught in 10% of all German schools.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Deutschland Grundschrift is a variable font with a weight range from
	Thin (100) to Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+DE+Grund+Guides">Playwrite DE Grund Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Deutschland-Grundschrift-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Deutschland Grundschrift characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This style is a simple precursive, entirely disconnected. The uppercase letters
	are simplified print forms, notable for a two-stroke 'R' and an 'M' with a
	raised middle point. Several lowercase letters retain the characteristic exit
	stroke typical of precursives. The letter 'k' is constructed using two strokes,
	and the 'f' features a straight descender, distinguishing it within this
	straightforward style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Deutschland-Grundschrift-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Deutschland Grundschrift appears in font menus with a two-letter
	country code ‘DE’ and a the ‘Grund’ abbreviation, <strong>Playwrite DE Grund</strong>.
	It features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Deutschland-Grundschrift-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Germany, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/germany/">
    primarium.info/countries/germany</a>.
</p>

<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>
<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite DE Grund", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Česko Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CZ">Playwrite Česko</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	There are two main models used for handwriting education in the Czech Republic.
	The first, known as <em>Zjednodušená psací latinka</em>, or Simplified Latin
	script, is a continuous cursive hand. This model was officially ratified by the
	education ministry of erstwhile Czechoslovakia in 1932 and underwent its last
	revision in 1978. The second model, Comenia Script, features unjoined letters
	and was endorsed by the ministry in 2012. The national curriculum, which was
	last published in 2013, provides no further prescriptions about handwriting,
	and as a result, schools have the autonomy to select either model for
	instruction.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Česko Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CZ/about?query=Playwrite+Czech#playwrite-esko-characteristics">Playwrite Česko.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Česko Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CZ’,
	<strong>Playwrite CZ Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Cesko, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/czech-republic/">
    primarium.info/countries/czech-republic</a>.
</p>

	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you

</p>

	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>

	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	There are two main models used for handwriting education in the Czech Republic.
	The first, known as <em>Zjednodušená psací latinka</em>, or Simplified Latin
	script, is a continuous cursive hand. This model was officially ratified by the
	education ministry of erstwhile Czechoslovakia in 1932 and underwent its last
	revision in 1978. The second model, Comenia Script, features unjoined letters
	and was endorsed by the ministry in 2012. The national curriculum, which was
	last published in 2013, provides no further prescriptions about handwriting,
	and as a result, schools have the autonomy to select either model for
	instruction.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Česko is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CZ+Guides">Playwrite CZ Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>

    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Česko characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This sloped continuous cursive style includes decorative capital letters. 'A'
	and 'H' feature looped crossbars, while 'G' has a cursive structure but lacks a
	descending stroke. 'M' and 'N' are constructed differently, with only one
	following a cursive format. The lowercase letters have looped ascenders and
	descenders. Curved entry strokes appear in 'm', 'n', and 'v', but are absent in
	'w'. The letter 'q' includes a mirrored loop in its descender.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Česko appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CZ’,
	<strong>Playwrite CZ</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cesko-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Cesko, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/czech-republic/">
    primarium.info/countries/czech-republic</a>.
</p>
<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CZ", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Cuba Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CU">Playwrite Cuba</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	Literacy education in Cuba is notable for its distinctive approach: students
	are introduced to two different styles of letters from the outset, one for
	reading and the other for writing. Textbooks feature print-style, typographic
	letters represented by either geometric or grotesque sans serifs for reading.
	These styles are consistent across all workbooks and textbooks, with the
	exception of those focused on writing and calligraphy. For these, a
	fully-joined, cursive style is used, drawing inspiration from calligraphic
	models from the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">United States</a>, notably the Palmer Method, created by Austin Palmer , and the Zaner-Bloser
	method, developed by Charles Paxton Zaner and his partner Elmer Ward Bloser.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Cuba Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CU/about#playwrite-cuba-characteristics">Playwrite Cuba.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Cuba Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CU’,
	<strong>Playwrite CU Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a>. To learn more about

	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/cuba/">

	ready to be used across your apps.

	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CU Guides", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.

</p>

	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.

	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	Literacy education in Cuba is notable for its distinctive approach: students
	are introduced to two different styles of letters from the outset, one for
	reading and the other for writing. Textbooks feature print-style, typographic
	letters represented by either geometric or grotesque sans serifs for reading.
	These styles are consistent across all workbooks and textbooks, with the
	exception of those focused on writing and calligraphy. For these, a
	fully-joined, cursive style is used, drawing inspiration from calligraphic
	models from the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">United States</a>, notably the Palmer Method, created by Austin Palmer , and the Zaner-Bloser
	method, developed by Charles Paxton Zaner and his partner Elmer Ward Bloser.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Cuba is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CU+Guides">Playwrite CU Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>

	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Cuba characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This style is a very slanted continuous cursive that draws inspiration from the
	Zaner-Bloser and D'Nealian models. It features cursive uppercase letters, some
	of which are quite complex, such as 'I', 'J', and 'G'. The lowercase letters
	have medium-length extenders with loops, present even in letters like 'p' and
	'q', and are formed using slow strokes. Notably, this style includes an
	italic-style 'r' and a 'z' with a flat top and a loop.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Cuba appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CU’,
	<strong>Playwrite CU</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Cuba-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Cuba, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/cuba/">
    primarium.info/countries/cuba</a>.
</p>
<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CU", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Colombia Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CO">Playwrite Colombia</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	The Colombian cursive style <em>‘letra pegada’</em> is visibly rooted in the
	traditions of the Palmer method, created by Austin Palmer (1860–1927) in the
	United States at the turn of the last century. It has many similarities with
	cursive writing models in North American countries (<a
		href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">
    United States</a>, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+MX">México</a>, and
	Canada), which also descend from the same style. This influence can be seen in
	the <em>‘cartillas’</em> or handwriting education booklets produced by private
	publishers, which play an essential role in the teaching of reading and writing
	in the country.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Colombia Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CO/about#playwrite-colombia-characteristics">Playwrite Colombia.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Colombia Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CO’,
	<strong>Playwrite CO Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Colombia, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/colombia/">
    primarium.info/countries/colombia</a>.
</p>
<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CO Guides", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	The Colombian cursive style <em>‘letra pegada’</em> is visibly rooted in the
	traditions of the Palmer method, created by Austin Palmer (1860–1927) in the
	United States at the turn of the last century. It has many similarities with
	cursive writing models in North American countries (<a
		href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">
    United States</a>, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+MX">México</a>, and
	Canada), which also descend from the same style. This influence can be seen in
	the <em>‘cartillas’</em> or handwriting education booklets produced by private
	publishers, which play an essential role in the teaching of reading and writing
	in the country.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Colombia is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CO+Guides">Playwrite CO Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Colombia characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Following the tradition and current use of these booklets, Playwrite Colombia
	is a very slanted continuous cursive. Its lowercase letters have medium-length
	ascenders and descenders with loops that favor writing whole words without pen
	lifts. Based on the Palmer style, these loops are mirrored in the descending
	strokes of letters 'f' and 'q'. Some uppercase letters, such as the 'G', 'L'
	and 'Z', have decorative and complex cursive shapes.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Colombia appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CO’,
	<strong>Playwrite CO</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Colombia-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Colombia, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/colombia/">
    primarium.info/countries/colombia</a>.
</p>

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CO", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>

	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Chile Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CL">Playwrite Chile</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	The most prevalent style of handwriting taught in Chile is known as
	<em>‘letra ligada’</em>, or joined letters. This form of cursive handwriting is
	introduced to children as early as 6 years old, either alongside print letters
	or as a standalone style. It can be seen as a slantless variant of
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+GB+J">English roundhand</a>, a calligraphic style that emerged in England, gaining widespread popularity
	in the 18th century, but Chilean type designers note that, while there are
	structural similarities between the two styles, there are also notable
	differences. For instance, <em>letra ligada</em> typically features shorter
	ascenders and descenders, and its uppercase letters are less ornate. This
	divergence is present in both contemporary typographic and calligraphic
	examples.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Chile Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CL/about#playwrite-chile-characteristics">Playwrite Chile.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Chile Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CL’,
	<strong>Playwrite CL</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-Guides_2.png" />

<p>

	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an

	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.

<p>

	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CL", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>

	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.

	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.

	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.

	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	The most prevalent style of handwriting taught in Chile is known as
	<em>‘letra ligada’</em>, or joined letters. This form of cursive handwriting is
	introduced to children as early as 6 years old, either alongside print letters
	or as a standalone style. It can be seen as a slantless variant of
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+GB+J">English roundhand</a>, a calligraphic style that emerged in England, gaining widespread popularity
	in the 18th century, but Chilean type designers note that, while there are
	structural similarities between the two styles, there are also notable
	differences. For instance, <em>letra ligada</em> typically features shorter
	ascenders and descenders, and its uppercase letters are less ornate. This
	divergence is present in both contemporary typographic and calligraphic
	examples.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Chile is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CL+Guides">Playwrite CL Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>

	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Chile characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This upright continuous cursive features a mix of uppercase styles. Letters
	like 'A' and 'N' are plain and cursive, whereas others such as 'Q' and 'T' are
	more decorative and intricate. The lowercase letters have medium-length
	extenders with loops and are characterized by their rounded forms and slow
	stroke speed. The letter 'q' is distinguished by a mirrored loop on its
	descender. The 'o' includes a knot, and the letters 'm', 'n', 'v', 'w', 'y',
	and 'z' begin with curved entry strokes.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Chile appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CL’,
	<strong>Playwrite CL</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Chile-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by

<p>
    Playwrite Canada Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CA">Playwrite Canada</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	The traditional method of handwriting instruction in Canada is called
	<em>MacLean’s Method of Writing</em>, and was developed by educator Henry
	Boyver MacLean in the mid-20th century. Building upon letter shapes devised by
	Austin Norman Palmer in the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">United States</a>, MacLean introduced several changes to suit the needs of school instruction,
	such as modifications to teaching methods and the addition of motor preparation
	exercises. Even though MacLean’s books have not been used in Canada for several
	years, his letter shapes survive in schoolbooks published by regional
	governments and private publishing houses. They are widely used in the majority
	of Canadian primary schools.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Canada Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CA/about#playwrite-canada-characteristics">Playwrite Canada.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Canada Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CA’,
	<strong>Playwrite CA Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Canada, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/canada/">
    primarium.info/countries/canada</a>.
</p>
<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CA Guides", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	The traditional method of handwriting instruction in Canada is called
	<em>MacLean’s Method of Writing</em>, and was developed by educator Henry
	Boyver MacLean in the mid-20th century. Building upon letter shapes devised by
	Austin Norman Palmer in the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">United States</a>, MacLean introduced several changes to suit the needs of school instruction,
	such as modifications to teaching methods and the addition of motor preparation
	exercises. Even though MacLean’s books have not been used in Canada for several
	years, his letter shapes survive in schoolbooks published by regional
	governments and private publishing houses. They are widely used in the majority
	of Canadian primary schools.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Canada is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+CA+Guides">Playwrite CA Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Canada characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This slanted continuous cursive style is influenced by the Zaner-Bloser and
	D'Nealian models. It includes cursive uppercase letters, with some particularly
	intricate ones like 'I', 'J', and 'G'. The lowercase letters feature
	medium-length extenders with loops, which are consistent even in letters like
	'p' and 'q', and are constructed using medium-speed strokes. Additionally,
	several lowercase letters such as 'm', 'n', 'v', 'w', 'y', and 'z' start with
	curved entry strokes at the x-height.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Canada appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘CA’,
	<strong>Playwrite CA</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Canada-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Canada, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/canada/">
    primarium.info/countries/canada</a>.
</p>
<hr />

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite CA", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Brasil Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BR">Playwrite Brasil</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	Educational Vertical cursive models first appeared in the 19th century in
	France, England, and the USA as simplified forms of their predecessors,
	Roundhand and Spencerian styles, respectively. The upright cursive writing did
	not enjoy a long period of popularity in northern European and Anglo-American
	countries. It was, however, widely adopted in Spain, Portugal, Italy, and
	France, where it is still used. From these countries, it traveled to erstwhile
	colonies such as Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, and Chile, among others. In
	Brazil, this resulted in the replacement of the then-popular models of
	handwriting, such as Palmer from the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">US</a> and
	commercial Roundhand script from England, with the vertical cursive approach.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Brasil Guides is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Brasil Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BR/about#playwrite-brasil-characteristics">Playwrite Brasil.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Brasil Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘BR’,
	<strong>Playwrite BR Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Brasil, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/brazil/">
    primarium.info/countries/Brasil</a>.

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite BR Guides", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
	Educational Vertical cursive models first appeared in the 19th century in
	France, England, and the USA as simplified forms of their predecessors,
	Roundhand and Spencerian styles, respectively. The upright cursive writing did
	not enjoy a long period of popularity in northern European and Anglo-American
	countries. It was, however, widely adopted in Spain, Portugal, Italy, and
	France, where it is still used. From these countries, it traveled to erstwhile
	colonies such as Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, and Chile, among others. In
	Brazil, this resulted in the replacement of the then-popular models of
	handwriting, such as Palmer from the
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+US+Trad">US</a> and
	commercial Roundhand script from England, with the vertical cursive approach.
</p>
<p>
	Playwrite Brasil is a variable font with a weight range from Thin (100) to
	Regular (400), and supports over 150 Latin-based languages.
	It has a single-weight sibling with Guides, 
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BR+Guides">Playwrite BR Guides</a>, 
	designed to harmonize seamlessly with this main font while providing a 
	visual aid for primary school children.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Brasil characteristics</h4>

<p>
	This style features a vertical continuous cursive with medium-length extenders,
	round letters, and a slow curve speed. The capital letters are predominantly
	cursive, with many designed to connect seamlessly to the following lowercase
	letters. 'Q' is notably distinctive in shape. Many lowercase letters begin with
	curved entry strokes. The letter 'q' includes a crossbar, 'f' features a
	mirrored bottom loop, and 'z' is characterized by a round form with a looped
	descender.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Brasil appears in font menus with a two-letter country code ‘BR’,
	<strong>Playwrite BR</strong>, and features four styles: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, and
	Regular.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the variable font and standard static ttf fonts
	for each style.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Brasil-2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in Brasil, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/brazil/">
    primarium.info/countries/Brasil</a>.
</p>

<h4>How to install the fonts?</h4>

<p>
	<strong>Windows:</strong> Download the font file to your computer. Navigate to
	where you saved the font file and double-click it to open. Click the "Install"
	button at the top of the font preview window. The font is now installed and
	ready to be used across your apps.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>macOS:</strong> After downloading the font file to your Mac,
	right-click it in Finder and select "Open With" > "Font Book". Then, click
	"Install Font" in the font preview window that pops up. The font is now
	installed and ready to be used across your apps.
</p>

<h4>How to use the fonts in apps?</h4>

<p>
	The Playwrite font family uses complex OpenType features to generate connected
	writing. Some common applications require these features to be manually
	activated.
</p>
<p>
	Note: This font family doesn't include Bold or Italic styles, so please avoid
	applying them in text editors. If you use the common 'B' and 'I' buttons, you
	will automatically generate low-quality styles.
</p>
<p>
    <strong>Google Docs and Slides:</strong> From the font selector drop-down, go to "More Fonts" 
    and search for the desired font name, in this case, "Playwrite BR", and click OK. 
    If some text is already selected, the font choice will apply.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Microsoft Word:</strong> Go to Format in the Menu bar, select Font, and
	then the Advanced tab. Activate "Contextual Alternates" and "Kerning for fonts
	below" to apply these settings to all text sizes.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>LibreOffice:</strong> In macOS, to select the different styles, go to
	Format in the Menu bar, select Character, and use the Typeface menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe InDesign:</strong> Open the Paragraph Panel and select Adobe
	"World-Ready Paragraph Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Illustrator:</strong> Navigate to Preferences > Type, check the
	"Show Indic Options" box, and close preferences. Then open the Paragraph Panel
	and select "Middle Eastern Composer" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	<strong>Adobe Photoshop:</strong> Access the Paragraph Panel, then choose
	"World-Ready Layout" from the contextual menu.
</p>
<p>
	The above instructions are also available in
	<a href="https://www.primarium.info/Playwrite_installation_notes.pdf">
    PDF format here</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Playwrite Belgique Wallonie-Bruxelles Guides is a single-weight font companion that harmonizes seamlessly with the main family, <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BE+WAL">Playwrite Belgique Wallonie-Bruxelles</a>. It includes guidelines on the baseline, x-height, ascenders, and descenders. These guides provide a visual aid for primary school children that helps young learners grasp the proportions of letterforms and assists them in drawing letters with confidence and accuracy.
</p>
<p>
	The Dutch-French language divide in Belgium, a phenomenon with roots stretching
	back to the Middle Ages, continues to be relevant in the country today.
	Traditions of handwriting education exemplify this circumstance and reflect the
	country's historical ties to France and the Netherlands. Regardless of the
	handwriting model adopted, students learn print-style script letters in
	kindergarten and progress to connected letters in primary school. In Flanders,
	there is a preference for
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BE+VLG">
    sloped continuous cursive writing</a>, reminiscent of Dutch handwriting models, whereas the French-speaking
	community in the Walloon region opts for upright cursive writing, a style that
	enjoys popularity in France. This diversity in handwriting education is a
	direct response to Belgium's rich linguistic culture, leading to the
	introduction of a second official language early in the school years.
</p>
<p>
	To contribute, see
	<a href="https://github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite/">
    github.com/TypeTogether/Playwrite</a>.
</p>
<hr />
<img src="Playwrite-Belgique-Wallonie-Bruxelles-Guides_1.png" />

<h4>Playwrite Belgique Wallonie-Bruxelles Guides characteristics</h4>

<p>
	Guidelines are present in all characters except for those used for letter/word spacing. To create a versatile tool for teachers when designing practice sheets that feature guidelines without corresponding letters, the underscore is used as a key character. In Playwrite Guides fonts the underscore prints only the guidelines, and matches the width of the normal word space.
</p>
<p>
    Find the detailed characteristics of this country's Model in <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playwrite+BE+WAL/about#playwrite-belgi-walloon-characteristics">Playwrite Belgique Wallonie-Bruxelles.</a>
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Belgique-Wallonie-Bruxelles-Guides_3.png" />
<h4>Family name in font menus</h4>
<p>
	Playwrite Belgique Wallonie-Bruxelles Guides appears in font menus with a two-letter country code
	‘BE’ and a the ‘WAL’ abbreviation <strong>Playwrite BE WAL Guides</strong>, and features a single Regular weight.
	<br />
	The download .zip file includes the static font for this guided version.
</p>
<img src="Playwrite-Belgique-Wallonie-Bruxelles-Guides_2.png" />

<h3>Playwrite fonts for schools</h3>
<p>
	The Playwrite school fonts are based on the findings of Primarium, a
	groundbreaking educational effort that documents the history and current
	practice of handwriting models taught to primary school students worldwide.
	This typographic engine serves teachers, educators, and parents by generating
	localized libre fonts. These Playwrite fonts are complemented by
	<a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playpen+Sans"> Playpen Sans</a>, an
	informal and fun typeface designed for annotations, instructions, and student
	notes – that also includes emojis.
</p>
<p>
	For more information about the Primarium project, visit
	<a href="https://primarium.info/">primarium.info</a> and to learn more about
	handwriting education in australia, see
	<a href="https://primarium.info/countries/belgium/">
    primarium.info/countries/belgium</a>.
</p>
